items: Last updated : 2024-04-08

title: 25B Information Technology Specialist
description:
Job Description

Job Description...

If you've ever considered a job in IT, become an Information Technology Specialist in the Army National Guard and expand your skills and experience with complex technologies. In this role, you will be responsible for sending, receiving, and processing messages and data on the Guard's sophisticated networks. You will also maintain and troubleshoot the systems that support the military's logistics and classified data, and build firewalls that can withstand any attempted cyberattack.

Job Duties
• Maintenance of networks, hardware, and software
• Provide customer and network administration services
• Construct, edit, and test computer programs

Some Of The Skills You'll Learn
• Use of computer consoles and peripheral equipment
• Computer systems concepts
• Planning, designing, and testing computer systems

Helpful Skills
• Interest in computer science
• Strong attention to detail
• Ability to communicate effectively
• Experience in installation of computers

Through your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career working as a network support technician, data processing technician, or computer programmer in just about any company that uses computers.

Earn While You Learn

Instead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.

Job training for an Information Technology Specialist consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 20 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) with classroom instruction.

Benefits/Requirements

Benefits
• Paid training
• A monthly paycheck
• Montgomery GI Bill
• Federal and State tuition assistance
• Retirement benefits for part-time service
• Low-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)
• 401(k)-type savings plan
• Student Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)
• Health care benefits available
• VA home loans
• Bonuses, if applicable
• Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change

Requirements
• Military enlistment in the Army National Guard
• Must be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificate
• Must be between the ages of 17 and 35
• Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standards
• Must meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)

Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.

Other Job Information

Job ID: 4314

ZIP Code: 49009

Job Category: Technology and Networking

Age Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 IT Computer electrical

title: IT Specialist
description:
Job Description

Join the Army National Guard as an Information Technology Specialist and learn valuable technical skills while serving your country. This role involves managing the military's sophisticated networks, maintaining systems that support logistics and classified data, and building firewalls to protect against cyber attacks...

Job Duties:
• Maintain networks, hardware, and software
• Provide customer and network administration services
• Construct, edit, and test computer programs

Skills You'll Learn:
• Computer system concepts and use of peripherals
• Network planning and testing
• Computer programming

Helpful Skills:
• Interest in computer science
• Attention to detail and communication skills
• Experience in computer installation

With training provided by the Army National Guard, you can use these skills in a civilian career as a network support technician, data processing technician, or computer programmer.

Benefits:
• Paid training
• Monthly paycheck
• Tuition assistance for federal and state college courses
• Retirement benefits for part-time service
• Low-cost life insurance
• 401(k)-type savings plan
• Healthcare benefits available
• VA home loans

Requirements:
• Be between the ages of 17 and 35
• Pass a physical exam and meet moral and legal standards
• Meet citizenship requirements

Enlistment in the Army National Guard is required for this position. Actual job duties and MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability

items: Computer system concepts and use of peripherals

Computer programming
Interest in computer science
Attention to detail and communication skills
Experience in computer installation
With training provided by the Army National Guard, you can use these skills in a civilian career as a network support technician, data processing technician, or computer programmer
Be between the ages of 17 and 35
Pass a physical exam and meet moral and legal standards
Meet citizenship requirements
Enlistment in the Army National Guard is required for this position

title: It support specialist
description:
Position : IT Support Specialist

Job Type : Fulltime, Permanent...

Location : Grand Rapids, MI (Remote 2 days / week)

About the Company :
• Opportunity to work partially remote.
• Continuous investment in peer-to-peer mentoring, paid training, and certifications.
• Collaborative, team-oriented environment everyone works together to achieve the goals of the organization.
• Great opportunity to expand on current IT knowledge and gain experience with a wide variety of hardware, software, and technology.

Job Description :

In this role, you'll be providing technical end-user support to a variety of client environments assisting with user administration, Office 365 Application support, software & hardware support, remote connectivity, & network support.

Great opportunity to work with a variety of tools, software & hardware.

Preferred Experience for the IT Support Specialist :
• Experience within a Help Desk or Technical support role utilizing a ticketing system and monitoring tools.
• Experience with Office 365 Administration Portal, Active Directory administration, and using Ticketing Systems or Remote Monitoring Management (RMM) tools like ConnectWise or similar.
• Familiarity with Firewalls, VLANs and Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
• Comfortable providing end-user support via phone, RMM tools, etc.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Bonus Experience for the IT Support Specialist :
• Certifications such as CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certifications, Cisco Certifications, etc.
• Experience working for a Managed Services Provider (MSP)
• Experience with any of the following : ConnectWise, IT Glue, SolarWinds, WatchGuard, Ruckus, Veeam, Cisco Networking Products, Extreme Network Products, Ubiquiti, VMWare, Dell, Axix, 3OX and Adobe.
• Experience with LAN / WAN, TCP / IP, Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Access Points, VPN, Citrix, VoIP, etc.

Benefits :
• Medical / Dental / Vision Insurance
• Retirement Plan w / 3% match
• 2 weeks PTO
• Paid Training & Certifications

INAPR2024

Last updated : 2024-04-07

Experience with LAN / WAN, TCP / IP, Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Access Points, VPN, Citrix, VoIP, etc

items: Last updated : 2024-04-07

title: Systems Specialist Senior
description:
General Summary

Maintains information technology systems resources for a large department in a distributed computing environment...

Major Duties
• Installs, configures, tests and debugs information technology systems including hardware, software, databases and peripherals.
• Maintains all system documentation.
• Establishes policies and procedures to ensure the reliability and security of the department’s information technology resources and compliance with the University’s standards.
• Provides training to end users or develops programs or documentation for end-user training.
• Provides technical support to end-users.
• Recommends new hardware or software to support the department’s programs and activities.
• Writes programming code to provide reports and analyses for end-users.
• Participates in University-wide information technology strategic planning teams.
• May hire, train and evaluate performance of staff or student employees.

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in related field from an accredited institution.
• Five years’ relevant experience.
• Experience installing and maintaining hardware and software.
• Experience maintaining system documentation.
• Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
• Programming experience.
• Applicable industry certification or relevant experience.
• Must be available to provide system maintenance or end-user support outside or normal business hours.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,267.00 - $93,440.00 per year

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Vision insurance

Experience level:
• 5 years

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Kalamazoo, MI 49008

items: Bachelor’s degree in related field from an accredited institution
Five years’ relevant experience
Experience installing and maintaining hardware and software
Experience maintaining system documentation
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Programming experience
Applicable industry certification or relevant experience
Must be available to provide system maintenance or end-user support outside or normal business hours
5 years

title: Faculty Specialist - Term
description:
The successful candidate will teach four courses per term at the undergraduate or graduate level in various cybersecurity areas. This position is potentially renewable.

The Department has 340 undergraduates, 100 M.S. students, and 10 Ph.D. students. We offer B.S. and M.S. degrees in computer science and cybersecurity, and a Ph.D. in computer science. The Department also plays a significant role in the offering of a B.S. and M.S. in data science.

WMU is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and all other qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
